section.title: afterstr
section.para: Return the part of the source string that comes after the first occurrence of the search string. If source doesn't contain any occurrences of search an empty string is returned.
For example:
sets the variable firstname to the value 'Bobbinson'.
results in text2 having a value of 'es on axes'.

section.title: atof
section.para: Converts the supplied text into its floating point (double) representation. Equivalent to the standard C routine 'atof'.
For example:
would set x to the value '1.099'.

section.title: atoi
section.para: Converts the supplied text into its integer representation. Equivalent to the standard C routine 'atoi'.
For example:
would set i to the value '23'.

section.title: beforestr
section.para: Return the part of the source string that comes before the first occurrence of the search string. If source doesn't contain any occurrences of search an empty string is returned.
For example:
places the text "Eng" in the variable target.
section.synopsis: string text1 = "No taxes on axes", text2; text2 = beforestr(text1, " ax");
section.para: places the text "No taxes on" in the variable text2.

section.title: contains
section.para: Returns the number of times the search string is found in the source string. The function counts only non-overlapping occurrences of search.
For example:
section.synopsis: string poem = "six sixes are thirty-six"; int count = contains(poem, "six");
section.para: sets count to '3'.

section.title: ftoa
section.para: Converts the supplied double d into a string representation.
For example:
would set num to the value "100.001".

section.title: itoa
section.para: Converts the supplied integer i into a string representation.
For example:
would set num to the value "54".

section.title: stripchars
section.para: Strip the supplied character(s) from the source string, returning the result.
For example:
places the text "Odles f ndles" in the variable abc.
strips all vowels from the input string, placing the text "Odls f ndls" in the variable abc.
